00151 /* Initialize keyboard handler (brings keyboard into RAW mode). Returns */
00152 /* 0 if succesful, -1 otherwise. */
00153     int keyboard_init(void);
00154 /* Similar, but returns console fd if succesful. */
00155     int keyboard_init_return_fd(void);
00156 /* Set event handler invoked by keyboard_update(). */
00157     typedef void (*__keyboard_handler) (int scancode, int press);
00158     void keyboard_seteventhandler(__keyboard_handler handler);
00159 /* Return keyboard to normal state. */
00160     void keyboard_close(void);
00161 /* Read raw keyboard device and handle events. Returns 0 if no event. */
00162     int keyboard_update(void);
00163 /* Similar to keyboard_update, but wait for an event to happen. */
00164 /* [This doesn't seem to work very well -- use select on fd] */
00165     void keyboard_waitforupdate(void);
00166 
00167 /* keyboard_init sets default event handler that keeps track of complete */
00168 /* keyboard state: */
00169 
00170 /* Result of keypressed. */
00171 #define KEY_NOTPRESSED 0
00172 #define KEY_PRESSED 1
00173 
00174 /* Modes for translatekeys. */
00175 #define TRANSLATE_CURSORKEYS 1  /* Map cursor block to keypad cursor. */
00176 #define TRANSLATE_DIAGONAL 2    /* Map keypad diagonal to keypad cursor. */
00177 #define TRANSLATE_KEYPADENTER 4 /* Map keypad enter to main enter key. */
00178 #define DONT_CATCH_CTRLC 8      /* Disable Crtl-C check. */
00179 
00180 /* Revert to default handler. */
00181     void keyboard_setdefaulteventhandler(void);
00182 /* Return pointer to buffer holding state of each key (scancode). */
00183 /* Value 1 corresponds to key that is pressed, 0 means not pressed. */
00184     char *keyboard_getstate(void);
00185 /* Force keyboard state to nothing pressed (all zeroes). */
00186     void keyboard_clearstate(void);
00187 /* Let default handler translate cursor key block events to numeric keypad */
00188 /* cursor key events and other translations. */
00189     void keyboard_translatekeys(int mask);
00190 
00191 /* Return nonzero if key is depressed. */
00192     int keyboard_keypressed(int scancode);
